metadata.title: CVE-2024-22861 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow vulnerability in FFmpeg before n6.1, allows attackers tocause a denial of service (DoS) via the avcodec/osq module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-22861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec60 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavdevice60 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter9 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra60 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat60 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavutil58 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libpostproc57 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
libswscale7 - 7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:6.1.1-1ubuntu1').
